com.pyramidacceptors.ptalk.api

Interface IConfiguration

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    RS232Configuration

    public interface IConfiguration
    Configuration is intended to be a globally available configuration
    for the selected serial protocol. The methods within should be common
    to all configuration implementations. This would include settings
    such as bill enabled or disabled or what events to listen for.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

    • Method Detail

      • setEventMask

        void setEventMask(int mask)
        Events are the foundation of the PTalk, event driven API. As a client,
        you are able to select which events (interface dependent) you want
        notification for. The mask is a bitwise integer where 1 indicates active and indicates
        inactive.
        Parameters:
        mask - bitwise event mask
        See Also:
        for bit indicies

      • getEventMask

        int getEventMask()
        Returns:
        the current event mask

      • setEnableMask

        void setEnableMask(int mask)
        Serial Protocol often allow for the enable/disable of bills or other
        features via a bit mask. This implementation supports an integer mask
        where 1 indicates the feature is enabled and 0 indicates that it is
        disabled.
        Parameters:
        mask - bitwise enable/disable mask. Set bit position to 1 to enable, 0 to disable.

      • setEnabled

        void setEnabled(boolean enable)
        Enable or disable the slave device if the protocol supports it.
        Parameters:
        enable - true will enable the device, false will disable

      • getEnabled

        boolean getEnabled()
        Returns:
        true if the device is enabled, otherwise false
